intro: Silene morisii, commonly known as the Moris's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Silene morisii is known for its small, oval leaves and its ability to bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
